text: Hey team, quick update on the Aurora migration: we're on track to cut over next Saturday (July 20). Platform team has been running dual-writes for 2 weeks and data integrity checks are passing.
Nice! What's the rollback plan if something goes wrong during cutover?
We keep the old PG instance running in read-only mode for 48 hours post-cutover. If we need to rollback, we flip the DNS back and replay the write log. Recovery time: ~15 min.
anyone going to the kitchen? can someone grab me a coffee lol

Team reminder: we're deprecating the old `/v1/analytics` endpoints on September 1. If your service still calls them, please migrate to `/v2/analytics` by August 15. The v2 docs are in Notion under API Migration Guide.
Also FYI — the new hire onboarding doc is outdated. It still references BambooHR for PTO requests. Someone should update it to reference Workday. I'll file a ticket.
🚀 Deploy: api-gateway v2.14.3 rolled out to production successfully. Canary: 0.02% error rate (baseline: 0.01%). Approved.

Quick question — is there a standard way to add feature flags in the workflow-engine? I see some services use LaunchDarkly directly and others use the internal wrapper. What's the recommended approach?
Use the internal wrapper (`meridian-flags` package). It adds caching and fallback behavior on top of LD. Direct LD calls are technically fine but the wrapper is preferred for consistency.
Thanks Mike! Where are the docs for that?
uhhh... good question. I don't think we documented it properly. The README in the `meridian-flags` repo has basic usage but it's pretty sparse. I'll add it to the tech debt backlog.
